attributes.action: Muslim school children to be allowed Eid as holiday
attributes.background: Muslim students in the UK don't get a holiday on the two Eid days every year - Eid ul Fitar and Eid ul Adha. Being the only two (or the biggest two) religious celebrations for the Muslims the students should get official holidays on these two occasions.
attributes.additional_details: Islam is the second largest religion with results from the United Kingdom Census 2011. The number of people practicing the religion of Islam in the United Kingdom exceeds 3 million. Some neighborhood towns have more than 50% Muslim population.

attributes.action: Make bridging hormone prescriptions easier to obtain for transgender people
attributes.background: The NHS constitution states that people must wait no longer than 18 weeks for an initial specialist appointment. Gender Identity Clinics are currently at least twice this. Many GPs currently refuse to prescribe hormones, despite the fact that for some, they are life saving treatments.
attributes.additional_details:
The WPATH standards of care (2011) suggest the prescribing of an interim ‘bridging’ prescription for a few months while the patient is referred to a gender specialist and an endocrinologist - http://www.rcpsych.ac.uk/files/pdfversion/CR181_Nov15.pdf 
If an individual has socially transitioned the GP may prescribe hormones - estrogen for trans women and testosterone for trans men - there is every indication that they are safe and effective.
Altered from A Guide for GPs and healthcare staff

attributes.action: October 15th a recognised day of Remembrance for Pregnancy and Infant Loss UK
attributes.background:
This month "The Lancet Report" has shown figures throughout the world for the loss of babies during pregnancy and Infancy.  We are 1:4 by statistic, 2.6 million babies died through Stillbirth in 2015, possibly 50% confirmed pregnancies end by miscarriage.
Help us honour and grieve openly worldwide.
attributes.additional_details:
A day of Remembrance is honoured within countries worldwide.  October 15th, 7pm candles are lit and parents, families and friends honour the lives taken to soon. The USA, Australia, Canada and through charities in Europe, such as Italy. 

Angel Parents UK & GLOBAL 
www.angelparents.co.uk 
T: Angel_parents 

Press reports
Interviews
Facts shared through charities such as SANDS, Tommy and The Miscarriage Association. 
Parents who share their stories

attributes.action: For every new teacher to learn about Speech, Language and Communication Needs
attributes.background: We are calling on the Government to include Speech, Language and Communication Needs (SLCN) as part of any initial teacher training package. All trainee teachers should learn about SLCN so that they are able to adapt their teaching strategies and fully support their students to succeed and achieve.
attributes.additional_details: In English Schools 20.9% of all children on Special Educational Needs (SEN) support & 14% of children that have an Education, Health and Care Plan (EHCP) have SLCN (DfE Schools, pupils and their characteristics: January 2016). Language Impairment is seven times more common than other developmental conditions such as autism (SCALES study 2016). Including SLCN on any initial teacher training package would raise awareness & allow new teachers to feel more confident at identifying these children.

attributes.action: Make the abuse and neglect of older people a crime
attributes.background: The constant reports of abuse and neglect of older people has gone on for too long. We are calling for such cruelty to be an aggravated criminal offence with statutory minimum sentences. This covers physical and sexual assault, financial and psychological abuse, and neglect.
attributes.additional_details: Most abusers are never charged, or if they are, they receive suspended sentences or community service. There are aggravated offences for Hate Crime, recognising basic charges are not enough. We want the same for older people. Action on Elder Abuse is a UK-wide charity that aims to protect and prevent the abuse of vulnerable older people. It has a national freephone helpline open Monday to Friday: 9:00 and 17:00 on 080 8808 8141 for confidential support and information. www.elderabuse.org.uk

attributes.action: Department of Transport to look into the service run by Abellio Greater Anglia.
attributes.background: Today train services were severely disrupted by overhead power cable failures. Even though Network Rail maintain these, the rolling stock is beyond fit for purpose with passengers sweltering in carriages.

attributes.action: Give survivors of domestic abuse anonymous registration on Electoral Register.
attributes.background:
For survivors of domestic abuse who have been to refuge, continued anonymity can be a matter of life and death. 

The Government must change the guidance so that people who are leaving refuge are automatically offered anonymous inclusion on the Electoral Register.
attributes.additional_details:
Current guidance asks for court documents or a letter of attestation which can only be provided by:
•	a police officer of or above the rank of superintendant
•	the Director General of the Security Service (MI5) or the Serious Organised Crime Agency
•	a director of adult social services or children’s services in England 
These people are difficult for any member of the public to contact, meaning many survivors do not register at all.

Further info:
http://huff.to/1J3BGW7
http://bit.ly/1Rq6Fuh

attributes.action: Introduce payment of the living wage to student nurses on placements.
attributes.background: Students nurses are working long hours and being used as free labour whilst our government has announced plans to scrap their bursary. Irrespective of the fate of the bursary (and with absolute certainty in the event of its loss), student nurses should be paid the living wage while studying.
attributes.additional_details: Current students are finding it difficult to cope financially, and the hours worked while on placement prohibit many from earning whilst studying. This financial issue is also a major problem in recruiting mature students into the profession. With the advent of the living wage, more mature students will be attracted to study, knowing that they can provide for themselves whilst doing so, and all students can focus their attention on their studies.

attributes.action: Call on Andrea Leadsom to NOT hold a vote to repeal the Hunting Act 2004.
attributes.background:
Andrea Leadsom has pledged to hold a vote to repeal the ban. The Hunting Act outlaws the hunting of foxes, deer, hare and mink with dogs.

Hunting wild animals with dogs and letting them get ripped apart for ‘entertainment’ is cruel and inhumane, and has no place in our civilized society.
attributes.additional_details:
Animals suffer physiological and psychological stress when chased by a hunt, whether they are killed or not. This was established as fact back in 2000 by a parliamentary inquiry (Burns et al., 2000), which led to the ban. 

The below references have proof and further info:

Burns, L. et al. (2000) Report of the committee of inquiry into hunting with dogs in England and Wales. The Stationery Office, London.

https://www.league.org.uk/~/media/Files/LACS/Publications/A-case-against-A4-report.pdf

attributes.action: Organ Donation: Switch to an Opt-Out System
attributes.background:
On average, 3 people die every day waiting for an organ to be donated.

The majority of Britons support organ donation and want to donate and yet a mere 29% of us are on the register.
attributes.additional_details:
By switching to an opt-out system, we can eliminate a large cause of the organ shortage: human inertia. We can save money by eliminating the need for marketing campaigns to stir us into action.

If a citizen feels strongly enough, he or she could simply remove himself from the database. Should they fail to do so, then at least our innate inertia might lead to some good.

attributes.action: UK Government Introduce Licensing for all Air Weapons and Protect our Cats
attributes.background: The Air Weapons and Licensing (Scotland) Act 2015 comes fully into effect on 31 December 2016.  The new law will require any person who possesses, purchases, uses or acquires an air weapon to have a certificate to hold them legally. We ask that the same be introduced in England and Wales.
attributes.additional_details: Research by Feline welfare charity Cats Protection found more cats are killed in air gun attacks than 20 years ago -  In 2016 46 per cent of air gun wounds proved fatal for cats compared to 11 per cent in 1996.The findings are particularly concerning, given a leading criminologist has warned that some people who shoot cats could go on to commit similar crimes against humans. We are calling for stricter regulation on the ownership of air guns, as we strongly believe this will help to protect cats and other members of our communities from attacks.

attributes.action: Make teacher training on ADHD compulsory in schools
attributes.background: So many parents are fighting to get a diagnoses for their child and when they finally get a Adhd diagnoses schools don't know how to manage it or simply dont believe it. Schools need more training. Stop labelling our children naughty and learn about the condition. Adhd is more complex! Make a change

attributes.action: An independent England, free of Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum it is clear that the Indivudual UK countries have different outlooks and different priorities. Let's separate the countries of the United Kingdom into independent countries, free to make their own laws and to control their own borders as they wish.

attributes.action: Create a Register For Animal Abusers
attributes.background: Animals cant speak for themselves but they are abused on a daily basis and this needs to stop Now, The government needs to act to ensure that the person or persons doing the abusing are banned from keeping or being near any animal for life.
attributes.additional_details: All abusers must also be brought to court and receive a proper sentence not just a fine or suspended sentence

attributes.action: Allow British expats and British nationals overseas the right to a dedicated MP
attributes.background: Expats and Gibraltar have no representation in the House of Commons. They should be able to return an MP who is specifically elected to serve British nationals overseas and Gibraltar.
attributes.additional_details: Expats and Gibraltar should be able to be represented and have their rights defended as many policies affect British nationals overseas however their voice cannot be heard

attributes.action: Increase funding for schools in poorly funded areas
attributes.background: The most poorly funded areas in England receive about 1.9 million less than the best. Highest funded receive approx £6,297. Wokingham receives UK's lowest at £4,158 per pupil. Fairer funding policy due 2017/18 may see highest funded grants reduced but no evidence of increased grants for Wokingham.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/nov/24/school-funding-system-fair-local-authorities

http://www.forest.wokingham.sch.uk/2m-underfunding-issue-for-Wokingham-Borough-Schools

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-31902536

http://www.ascl.org.uk/news-and-views/news_news-detail.gap-between-best-and-worst-funded-schools-equivalent-to-40-teachers.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-34891689

attributes.action: Reject the plan to devolve powers to a Metro Mayor for The West of England.
attributes.background: The Chancellor of The Exchequer announced on March 16th a scheme to devolve powers to a Metro Mayor in Bristol, Bath and surrounding areas. Given that B&NES rejected an elected Mayoral model one week earlier, this new announcement seems to be at variance with the electorate's preferences.

attributes.action: The UK government to endorse the KRG request of independence at UN level.
attributes.background: Kurdistan government has signalled it wish to get Kurdistan region of Iraq to became an independent state. To achieve it, it will need countries such as UK to endorse and support this wish as well as assist in advocating it.
attributes.additional_details: The Kurdistan regional government has demonstrated incredible ability to learn an effective and democratic governance system. Recently it has also demonstrated to have a well discipline and professional army and security services in fighting the ISIS. On the other side ongoing disagreement with Iraqi central government on funding and on sharing of oil production revenue are harming the sustainability of all achievements as well as affecting Kurdistan to achieve its development potential.

attributes.action: Members of BBC Trust should be elected by the public not appointed by government
attributes.background: The BBC Trust is the governing body of the BBC & are supposed to ensure that the BBC lives up to standards of accuracy and fairness. The Trust is responsible for approving BBC Editorial Guidelines. Currently, the Trust is appointed by the government. This should be replaced with public elections.

attributes.action: The Govnt must impartially prepare & publish an Exit Plan BEFORE the referendum.
attributes.background: The UK Government, having afforded the British Public a referendum on its membership of the EU, must now act promptly, professionally (as a GOVERNment) and impartially to create a detailed Exit Transition Plan so the British Public are informed BEFORE the referendum.

attributes.action: Declare the 23 June EU referendum null as many UK expatriates were unrepresented
attributes.background: There are some 3 million expatriate UK citizens, equivalent to around one-tenth of the total votes cast in the referendum. Many have been denied a vote as they have been living abroad for 15 years or more. Had their votes been recognised, they could have tipped the balance in favour of Remain.
attributes.additional_details: Of an estimated 3 million expatriate UK citizens, the 1.2 million living in EU countries are those most immediately affected by Brexit, yet many of their voices have not been heard. The fact that they have not been UK-resident for 15 years should not exclude them from voting in an issue of great importance with a direct impact upon their lives. Their numbers would be sufficient to change the result in favour of Remain. The referendum should be declared null, or repeated with full representation.

attributes.action: The UK Government must cut diplomatic ties with Israel until it obeys the law.
attributes.background:
We call on the UK Government to cut diplomatic ties with Israel until such time as it complies with International law.

Israel must end its settlement activity and unlawful occupation of Palestinian land. It is illegal under International law.
attributes.additional_details: Israel must cease its expansion and occupation of all foreign territories. International laws are there for a reason, and the governments that allow Israel to continue its brutal occupation and subjugation of Palestinians are complicit in this brutality. Israel must not be allowed to continue to break International law with impunity. We ask our government to explain why it allows the occupation to continue while maintaining its friendship with a state which acts in this way.

attributes.action: Regulations restricting UK travel companies charging adult prices for under 18s
attributes.background: 15-17 year olds are charged 'adult' train fares by travel companies across the UK, despite being legally classified as minors. We are paid less than over 18s for doing exactly the same jobs, yet are expected to pay the same ludicrous travel fares. Regulations should be put in place to prevent this.
attributes.additional_details: This campaign was set up by Fare Travel UK, a student pressure group established in 2016 at the College of Richard Collyer.

attributes.action: Urgently review application of LHA rates to social housing.
attributes.background: Social housing is allocated according to need. Those with highest need get housed. Help them reach independence and be less reliant on public services by providing specialist accommodation, which is covered by housing benefit, with clear exit plans to reach well being, confidence and self reliance.

attributes.action: No TPD directive until the public decide on staying in or leaving the EU.
attributes.background: Vaping has clearly saved many many lives that will now potentially be lost under the new TPD. This is an industry that has regulated itself very well prior to the the TPD with very few cases of injury and certainly illness due to using liquids.
attributes.additional_details: We know there is a lot in government who support vaping. This as a new law made by the EU should not be implemented until we the people have decided on our future in the EU itself.

attributes.action: British farmers should legally have to be paid at least the cost of production.
attributes.background: Farming is one of the only industries in which businesses are paid less than the cost of production. Take the dairy industry for example; the cost of producing a pint of milk is between 25 - 33.5 pence per litre (1), yet the majority of British farmers are paid under 20 pence per litre (2
attributes.additional_details:
Continuing to use dairy as an example, since 2000, more than half of British dairy farms have closed down, reducing from over 28,000 to under 10,000 (3), and this trend shows no signs of slowing down. 'Nearly one in 10 dairy farms across England and Wales have closed in the last three years' (4).

But this doesn't just affect dairy farmers, there are forecasts that the income for many others are due to drop by the following amounts this year alone (5):
Cereals down 24%
General cropping down 17%
Pigs down 46%

attributes.action: Reconsider debating ignored petition on Jeremy Hunt signed by 330k
attributes.background: The petitions committee recently chose not to debate a petition signed by almost 330,000 who have no trust in Jeremy Hunt as Health Secretary. This is not acceptable. The public have spoken. He has lied about mortality and ignored the concerns of the medical profession who wholeheartedly disagree.
attributes.additional_details: Jeremy seems to be immune to being held to account by parliament & the public he serves. He has caused a crisis within the NHS -a crisis of trust, of poor morale, and of recruitment & retention. He's gone about his plans for a 7 day NHS in completely the wrong way, alienating a generation of doctors & public. He's lied about mortality rates & imposed a deeply unpopular contract on junior Drs, claiming that David Dalton's letter with CEO 'support' is adequate assurance of the contract's quality

attributes.action: Keep Illustrious(Formerly HMS Illustrious) In the UK - open her up to the Public
attributes.background: HMS Illustrious (R06) - Served as a Carrier for the united Kingdom and is now the last in her class - Launched on the 14th December 1978 and Laid up In reserve as of 2015. Lusty as she is known to plenty of ex serving Naval Personnel wish to save her and allow her to stay within the United Kingdom
attributes.additional_details:
Launched on the 14th December 1978.
By 2014 she was the oldest ship in the Royal Navy's active fleet.
In May 2011 Illustrious was made operational after a £40 million refit.
The Ministry of Defence also announced that Illustrious, as the last of the Invincible-class aircraft carriers, will be preserved as a memorial "in recognition of the service given by these ships in protecting the UK over the last 30 years"
Laid up In reserve as of 2015

attributes.action: We the people of Great Britain will not advocate war against Russia regardless .
attributes.background: The movement of troops and growing provocation towards Russia has not been and will not be advocated by the British people, we will not stand by and watch another senseless war with countless deaths. President Obama and his administration have an agenda, WE, the people of Great Britain do not .
attributes.additional_details:
Time and again, it has been proved that media is manipulated by government for its own gains, WE, the people of Great Britain will no longer listen to your propaganda, who knows what you greedy suits want. WE the people of Great Britain can not emphasize how important it is for you to listen to us now, DO NOT FOLLOW AMERICA TO WAR, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED, DEMOCRACY MEANS YOU DO AS WE SAY, WE ARE WATCHING YOU, CROSS US AT YOUR PERIL. 


http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-36575180

attributes.action: Electoral Commission to investigate all fraud in any Parliamentary Election
attributes.background: Police under the Representation of the People Act 1983, investigate alleged breaches of rules around candidate spending in Elections.  This calls for reform bringing it under the 2000 Political Parties, Elections and Referendums Act 2000 and under the jurisdiction of the Electorial Commission.
attributes.additional_details:
On Monday 8th of February 2016 Channel 4 aired a documentary regarding overspending in 3 by-elections by the Conservatives.  I was compelled to make a complaint to the Electoral Commission who said it was a police matter.

Kent Police passed me on to Action Fraud and on and on it went.  Hours later I was back with the Electoral Commission who again said that it was a police matter.  Electoral Fraud obviously goes into "the difficult box" with the police and they should be relieved of this duty.

attributes.action: No sale or privatisation of the Land Registry.
attributes.background: Since 1862 the Land Registry has recorded the ownership of land and property in England and Wales and produces data on house prices and transactions that are used by the government to make policy decisions.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government is, once again, against professional advice, taking the first steps which will lead to a sell-off or part privatisation of the Land Registry to apparently pay down debt as if it is running a household.

The Land Registry is a highly respected and trusted institution. It is profitable. Yet the Government believes it would be better value for money if it were privatised.

We ask the Government to reconsider these ill-founded plans and preserve the Land Registry in its current form.

attributes.action: TOEIC affected students should be paid compensation by the Home Office.
attributes.background:
Theresa May faces parliamentary investigation over flimsy basis for student deportations
Theresa May is to face a parliamentary investigation after an immigration tribunal ruled that the Home Office used unscientific “hearsay” to deport thousands of students from Britain.
attributes.additional_details:
The Home Office revoked the licences of around 60 educational institutions across the country.
These led to the detention and removal of thousands of international students and migrants the Home Office claimed had obtained English certificates through fraud.
However, the Upper Tribunal heard that the Home Office’s evidence had “multiple frailties and shortcomings” and that Home Office witnesses had no scientific expertise in the voice recognition software at the heart of the fraud.

attributes.action: Allow the ownership of handguns in the UK
attributes.background: I am a young shooter and I take great pride in my sport, however I am saddened to see I have had my rights restricted due to the actions of a few and I am fed up of being blamed for the acts of terror committed which does not involve gun owners in any way. Join the Gun Owners United Facebook page.
attributes.additional_details: I believe we should be allowed to own handguns for sporting purposes in the UK. Criminals do not buy guns legally so banning legal gun owners form owning handguns does not reduce crime but instead restricts certain areas of the sport of shooting and this is unfair and NEEDS to end. It is time for all gun owners to unite as one to deal with this problem and get are rights back weather you want a handgun or not. Soon they will push to ban all guns, so we must make the first move to prevent this.

attributes.action: Require all UK broadband/telephone lines to become fibre to the property (FTTP).
attributes.background: Less than 1% of UK telephone and broadband lines provide fibre to the property (FTTP). BT Openreach, the monopoly owner of the UK's broadband infrastructure continue to focus on copper connections to the property (FTTC). This is harming the UK economy and must change.
attributes.additional_details: The UK's broadband network is now a matter of national economic and social importance, but BT Openreach, the monopoly owner of the UK's broadband network focuses only on providing copper cables to the property (FTTC). Less than 1% of UK telephone and broadband connections have fibre all the way to the property, which is the only future proof method of delivering fast, reliable broadband. Broadband connects businesses and individuals to the trade routes of the 21st century and Portugal, Denmark, Germany, France and Italy all outstrip the UK in deploying fibre to the property. This must change if the UK economy is to thrive.

attributes.action: Merge class 2 and and pcv licences into one
attributes.background:
Bus drivers carry the most precious cargo in the world, but cant drive a 32 tonne lorry full of groceries 
Give category D license holders their class 2 lgv license

attributes.action: Prevent the new HS2 proposed line passing through Bramley, Rotherham
attributes.background: HS2 are proposing a new route for the line to pass through the village of Bramley. This means it will be dangerously close to local housing and other ameneties which raises a number of concerns including:- safety of local children, noise polution, negative impact on house prices, to name (but) a few

attributes.action: Royal Navy ships must return rescued migrants and not bring them into Europe.
attributes.background: Europe is currently suffering from a migration crisis.  This includes migrants attempting to reach Europe in inadequate and overloaded boats.  The Navy has been sent to help with the rescue of those who get into difficulties, but the policy is to bring them into countries already overwhelmed.
attributes.additional_details: People-traffickers are effectively being aided by our Navy, as they merely take the migrants part way in unsuitable craft and leave it to us to complete the journey for them.  This encourages further attempts, putting people's lives at risk, as well as adding to the crisis in such places as Greece and Italy - which then is passed on to us.  While it is humane to rescue, we must send the migrants back, not help them on their way.
attributes.creator_name: Stella Leonora Rosemary Gheury de Bray

attributes.action: The massive increase in court fees needs to be reversed for access to justice
attributes.background: Court fees have increased in some cases by 600% in recent times in civil matters. Employment cases have seen fees introduced to very high levels, and divorce fees have also recently been hiked again. The high rise in fees is causing a barrier to justice, and debate is urgently required.
attributes.additional_details:
Concern has been raised by practitioner groups, and senior judiciary, and the effect has been seen, most particularly in the employment sector where a 70% reduction in numbers of issued cases has occurred.

Small businesses, and those who have been caused damage and loss are now expected to pay massively hiked fees, ironically at a time when legal costs have been roundly criticised by the government.

attributes.action: Allow britain as a whole to vote for our capital londons mayor
attributes.background: We think as a nation who now is independent should have a say on who is made our capitals mayor the whole of britain should vote in for our capitals mayor
attributes.additional_details: Only london votes for the capitals mayor and we britain should have a say as it is our capital not just a city or town

attributes.action: Provide information about the EU referendum on 23 June in British Sign Language.
attributes.background: On 23 June, UK voters will decide whether to leave or remain in the EU. Neither the UK Government nor the Leave/Remain campaigns have produced any information in British Sign Language about the referendum and its implications. Deaf voters who use BSL must not be excluded from this historic debate!
attributes.additional_details:
BSL was recognised by the UK Government as a language in its own right in March 2003. In September 2015, the Scottish Parliament enshrined the promotion and protection of BSL in law in the BSL (Scotland) Act.

With two months to go to the election, no materials in BSL have been released by the Government or the Leave/Remain campaigns. We were told by gov.uk that this was because of "extremely low demand", but we have seen no evidence that any consultation with the Deaf community took place.

attributes.action: SOS: Save Our Surgery- The University Health Centre Huddersfield Is Under Threat
attributes.background: Please stop NHS England imposing funding cuts of £330,000 to our practice budget - just because we have a young practice population.
attributes.additional_details: Our patients are being valued at around 70% of an 'average' price per patient simply due to their age. Healthcare is important at this stage of a student's life as they are often, for the first time are dealing with their own healthcare needs, together with juggling other pressures of moving away from family and friends (often from another country) and are learning to cope with the transitional changes that a move to University entails - emotional/financial/academic pressures. Health needs are varied and different to that of a "normal" GP practice but nevertheless important.

attributes.action: Provide All Children Under 16 With A Constant Glucose Monitor/Dexcom.
attributes.background:
Type One Diabetes, is a stressful, complicated disease. It is caused by the bodies immune system attacking itself, people have this disease through no fault of their own.
4 or more injections are needed daily in order for type ones to survive. As well as constant blood tests.
attributes.additional_details:
When a child is diagnosed, it is extremely difficult for a caregiver or parent to manage their Diabeties, due to them not knowing what their blood sugar levels are and will have to do more blood tests on that child than normal. A Constant Glucose Monitor, such as the Dexcom would make the child's quality of life so much better. A parent can also have some more reassurance that their child is not suffering from hypoglycaemia or hyperglycaemia. 
Type one diabetes can kill. We need this!

attributes.action: Remove liquid security restrictions at UK airports for operating cabin crew.
attributes.background: Remove restrictions on cabin crew bringing liquids through airport security. The fact that cabin crew have access to a toxic fire extinguisher and an axe but we can't bring a yogurt or water to work seems completely ridiculous and potentially unsafe.

attributes.action: Parliament should make "essay writing mills" illegal
attributes.background: I believe there are important values that hold human society together: If you work hard, act with integrity, be creative and solve problems then you should get ahead in life. In my opinion, ‘Essay Writing Mills’ are not in accordance with these values. They should be made illegal.
attributes.additional_details: They’re online. They’re in newsagents. They’re being handed around on our campuses. They’re even on the London Underground! Advertisements for ‘Essay Writing Mills’ are appearing everywhere as this industry grows bigger and bigger. More and more students are paying these ‘companies’ to do their work for them. Profiting from selling essays in this way should be illegal. We need to hold our students and our society to a higher standard.

attributes.action: Reduce the 3.9% interest rate on student loans
attributes.background:
I graduated in 2015 with £46,429 of debt. This is subject to an interest rate of 3.9%.

Paying back 9% of my salary over £21k p.a., only if I earn £41k am I actually reducing my total debt.

I ask the Government to reduce the 3.9% interest rate which is out of line with current interest rates.
attributes.additional_details:
A graduate earning £28k p.a. with the same level of debt would (under Plan 2) pay £630 a year but in that year the interest on the loan would total £1810.

By all means the Government can make it easier for graduates by reducing the (Plan 2) 3.9% interest rate but they should not otherwise make the terms of the loan more arduous (as in the 2015 Autumn Statement which froze the £21k salary threshold for 5 years, thereby increasing the annual repayments of many graduates over the next 5 years).

attributes.action: Increase award of Queens Silver Jubilee Medal.
attributes.background: The Queen Elizabeth II Silver Jubilee Medal  was created by a Royal Warrant but only 30,000 were distributed in Britain, resulting in only a small number being awarded to members of HM Armed Forces.  Subsequent Jubilee medals were awarded to all serving members of HM Armed Forces.
attributes.additional_details: In recognition of all those who served in HM Armed Forces at the time of Her Majesty's  Silver Jubilee, the existing monies in the Queens Silver Jubilee Trust should now be used to ensure an equitable distribution of the Silver Jubilee Medal.

attributes.action: Stop the College of Policing from requiring that policing officers need a degree
attributes.background: Alex Marshall and the College of Policing are planning on introducing a requirement for new police officers to first obtain a degree. This will impact on candidates from deprived backgrounds and plunge recruits into debt. Policing will no longer be open to all. It will be for the privileged few.
attributes.additional_details:
The College of Policing plan to pilot this in 2017 and introduce it in 2019.
We need to keep policing open to all. It does not require a degree, it requires common sense, bravery and compassion.

attributes.action: Abolishment of the Scottish Parliament returning all powers to Westminster
attributes.background: It's time the Scottish Parliament was closed down and a referendum should be held to allow people of the United Kingdom to choose whether there tax payers money should continue to be wasted on having a Scottish Parliament

attributes.action: Mandatory health insurance for non UK citizens
attributes.background: Introduce health insurance for non UK citizens

attributes.action: Save Bolsover Community Hospital from closure
attributes.background: Bolsover community hospital is under threat from the public services cuts imposed by the current government. We need your help in saving our hospital which provides fantastic services and relieves the pressure on the larger hospitals which are already under strain.
attributes.additional_details: Bolsover community hospital is under threat of closure from the severe cuts facing all public services. The hospital offers physiotherapy treatment and advice, intermediate care services aiming to prevent people from being admitted to hospital which is essential for all major hospitals in the current financial climate and mental health services for the elderly which are essential in any community. Bolsover has lost a lot over the years, let's not add our hospital to the ever growing list.
